brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective observational study on predictors available and on variables of difficult
      intubation adopting Gliscope video laryngoscope routinely.

      Primary hypothesis of the current study is that the rate of difficult intubation with
      Glidescope  is low and multiple predictors interact favorably in anticipating difficulties.

clinical_study.brief_title: Difficult Intubation With Glidescope Video Laryngoscope

detailed_description.textblock:
All possible factors involved in difficult intubations were included in this prospective
      analysis.

      Main predictors were considered: time to Cormack Lane using Glidescope intubation, Cormack
      Lane score, experience of the operator (staff or resident), number of bag mask ventilation,
      number of intubation attempts.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  any patient up to ASA4 eligible for intubation for neurosurgical procedures

          -  any anesthesiologist in charge for GA

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  children

          -  patient not suitable for clinical evaluation of predictors for difficult intubation
             (ie. Parkinson's disease)

study_pop.textblock:
Patients undergoing neurosurgical procedures eligible for intubation in a tertiary
        neurosurgical centre

clinical_study.official_title: Incidence and Predictors of Difficult Intubation Adopting an Institutional Algorithm Glidescope Based: a Cohort Study

primary_outcome.description: Difficult intubation in the current study  is measured using Adnet score including the number of laryngoscopies
